intro: Artrolobium, commonly known as the moonflower, is a genus of flowering plants native to South America. It belongs to the nightshade family, Solanaceae, and is characterized by its large, showy white flowers that open at night. The plants typically have hairy stems and alternate leaves with a broad, ovate shape. Artrolobium species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking nocturnal blooms. They require well-drained soil and thrive in warm, humid environments.
